intro: Oocephala agrianthoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of fleshy, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of white, purple, and pink, often with a contrasting throat. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular houseplant. Its ability to bloom throughout the year makes it a favorite among indoor gardeners.
